description.value:
Your sudden change of appearance creates an opening for an attack.

Prerequisites: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.GcVVfpQ79HdcMqBt]{Bluff} 1 rank, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.aayAhTaRzitONs5U]{Disguise} 1 rank

Benefit: Whenever you use an item, spell, or ability that allows you to disguise yourself as a standard action (such as @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.HGg3fIQGDzUwueVa]{disguise self}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.equipment.BqC7LI0RlKsBmgAH]{holoskin}, the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.racial-features.VY40amXS8nx7pTRY]{change form} species trait, or the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Z3MPGoaXFFLHxv35]{quick disguise} operative exploit), you can feint as part of the action. When you do so, you attempt a Disguise check in place of a Bluff check to determine the results of your feint; this doesnâ€™t include any additional bonuses the disguise ability grants, such as the +10 bonus to Disguise checks when casting disguise self.

Once a creature observes you using Morphing Feint (whether or not your feint is successful), that creature is immune to further uses of your Morphing Feint for 1 hour unless you also spend 1 Resolve Point when using Morphing Feint against it.

Special: If you also have the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.feats.11cfGGiQ9oTi4f9G]{Improved Feint} and @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.feats.Na3uzNO5IH4xQ4ku]{Flashmorph} feats, you can combine the effects of Morphing Feint with any effect that allows you to disguise yourself as part of a move or full action (such as from the Flashmorph feat). If you do so while performing a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.MBNI94tbMoqizPUk]{trick attack}, you attempt a Disguise check with a +4 bonus to resolve the trick attack instead of using any other skill. If you have these two feats as well as the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.YMCpBDLSA6feLBen]{clever feint} or @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.tL68g6bfFLpA9JMF]{clever attack} envoy improvisations, once per minute when you use either improvisation, you can also disguise yourself as part of that action with an item, spell, or ability you could use as a standard action.
